body.p: The IFRIC noted that an asset distribution by an entity to its owners is an example of a transaction between an entity and its owners. Transactions between an entity and its owners can generally be categorised into the following three types:

li.p: exchange transactions between an entity and its owners.
non‑reciprocal transfers of assets by owners of an entity to the entity. Such transfers are commonly referred to as contributions from owners.
non‑reciprocal transfers of assets by an entity to its owners. Such transfers are commonly referred to as distributions to owners.
